title: Public Information Request – Ernest Willis Case Files and Interrogation Material

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Public Information Officer,

Under the Texas Public Information Act, I am requesting access to all available records related to the conviction and exoneration of Ernest Willis, who was wrongfully convicted of arson and sentenced to death in 1987, then exonerated in 2004.

Requested records include:

Interrogation footage/transcripts, reports from Pecos County law enforcement

Arson investigation reports, expert testimony, and appeals

Trial documents and court filings

Any Texas Rangers or DPS involvement in re-investigating the case

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brown Pearl

title: FOIL Request – Misconduct Investigations and Interrogation Records Relating to Det. Louis Scarcella

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIL Officer,

Under New York’s Freedom of Information Law, I request all records related to interrogations, convictions, and internal investigations involving Detective Louis Scarcella, particularly the cases of:

Shabaka Shakur

Vanessa Gathers


Please include:

Interrogation videos/transcripts

Internal affairs investigations, complaints, and disciplinary records

Trial exhibits, police memos, and correspondence with the DA’s office

Documentation of exonerations, settlements, and re-investigations

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brown Pearl

title: Interrogation Records for McCloud, Cameron, and Walters (Queens Wrongful Conviction)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Interrogation Records for McCloud, Cameron, and Walters (Queens Wrongful Conviction)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIL Officer,

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I request access to all records relating to the wrongful convictions of David McCloud, Corey Cameron, and Richard Walters, who were recently exonerated in 2023 after decades of incarceration stemming from coerced confessions in Queens.

Requested items include:

Video/audio and transcripts of interrogations

Police reports, documentation of interviews without counsel

Any internal reviews, Brady material disclosures, or reinvestigations

Court documents regarding their exoneration and DA findings

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brown Pearl

title: FOIA Request – Interrogation and Wrongful Conviction of Gary Gauger 1993

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA Request – Interrogation and Wrongful Conviction of Gary Gauger 1993
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIA Officer,

Under the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (5 ILCS 140), I respectfully request access to all records related to the interrogation and conviction of Gary Gauger for the 1993 murders of his parents, Ruth and Morris Gauger. He was exonerated in 1996.

Specifically, I am requesting:

All interrogation audio/video recordings and transcripts involving Gary Gauger

Police reports, internal memos, and documentation regarding interrogation tactics

Trial exhibits, court filings, and appeals documentation

Chain of custody records for any video/audio evidence

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brown Pearl
